Chapter 2 Topic of Section Text Text 2.1 Subtopic Text Text 2.1.1 Code examples output_dir <- "code_output" if (!dir.exists(output_dir)) { dir.create(output_dir) } iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + theme_bw() ggsave(file.path(output_dir, "test_ggplot2.png")) ## Saving 7 x 5 in image 2.1.2 Image example 2.1.3 Video examples 2.1.4 Embedded files examples Example of including a website: Example of including an html file hosted on GitHub: 2.1.5 Citation examples We can put citations at the end of a sentence like this (Xie 2016). Or multiple citations (Xie 2016, @rmarkdown2018). but they need a ; separator (Xie 2016; Xie, Allaire, and Grolemund 2018). but they need a ; separator [ \[@bookdown2016\](#bookdown2016); \[@rmarkdown2018\](#rmarkdown2018)]. In text, we can put citations like this Xie (2016). Here’s a silly example which may mess up references. library(oro.nifti) ## oro.nifti 0.11.0 img <- oro.nifti::nifti() img@.Data ## , , 1, 1 ## ## [,1] ## [1,] 0 2.2 Print out session info devtools::session_info() ## Chapter 3 Uses cases for Bookdown to Leanpub Including a figure from the resources. This shouldn’t be an issue in the future knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") Figure 3.1: caption for first figure, we need multiple so make sure it works knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/tools.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/tools.png") (#fig:right_tools)caption for local png knitr::include_graphics("https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e9/Felis_silvestris_silvestris_small_gradual_decrease_of_quality.png") Figure 3.2: caption for url png Including a figure from the resources. Chapter 4 Figures 4.1 Make a plot This is the same code as in chapter 2, but here we can show how setting knitr chunks helps us tidy stuff up. library(here) ## here() starts at /home/rstudio library(ggplot2) library(magrittr) iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + theme_bw()
